medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening abdominal pain and anorexia with nausea/vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms have worsened since her last discharge 5 weeks ago, with increasing anorexia and dysgeusia. Abdominal discomfort is described as a burning pain located in the epigastrium, which is worse with food and relieved by rest. Episodes of nausea and non-bilious non-bloody emesis are noted, but there are no reports of fever, chills, diarrhea, melena, or bright red blood per rectum.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Small cell lung cancer; 2. Hypertension; 3. GERD; 4. Obesity, status post gastric bypass surgery; 5. Osteoarthritis; 6. Osteopenia; 7. History of left humerus fracture status post radiation; 8. Status post cholecystectomy; 9. Status post hysterectomy for uterine fibroids; 10. Status post bilateral cataract surgery; 11. Glaucoma.
medical_history.family_history: Father deceased from cirrhosis; aunt with colon cancer.
